sentences.sContent: Still, Professor Carlson does concede there are two significant aspects about 11/11/11 that can be construed as lucky even by people like him who don't believe in numerology.
sentences.sContent_eng: Still, Professor Carlson does concede there are two significant aspects about 11/11/11 that can be construed as lucky even by people like him who don't believe in numerology.
sentences.sCn: 但卡尔森教授仍然勉强同意，甚至像他这样不相信数字命理学的人也得承认，这一天有两个可以称之为幸运的因素。

sentences.sContent: Camping plunged confidently into biblical numerology: God revealed to Noah in the year 4990 BC that there would be yet 7 days until the flood of waters would be upon the earth.
sentences.sContent_eng: Camping plunged confidently into biblical numerology: God revealed to Noah in the year 4990 BC that there would be yet 7 days until the flood of waters would be upon the earth.
sentences.sCn: 康屏自信满满地让自己沉浸在圣经的数字命理学中：公元前4990年上帝启示诺亚说还有7天时间洪水就要淹没大地了。

words.tran: 数值的；数字的；用数字表示的（等于numeric）
计算；数字的读法；[数] 命数法；编号

trans.tranCn: (根据出生日期等数字来解释人的性格或占卜祸福的)数字命理学
trans.tranOther: Numerology is the study of particular numbers, such as a person's date of birth, in the belief that they may have special significance in a person's life
